column4: does anyone know why a dist-upgrade would cause weird glibc (at least it seems it is glibc) errors when starting xterm?
I feel like i shouldve done an 'upgrade' rather than 'dist-upgrade' and now not sure how to fix this glibc prob
possibly because you haven't upgraded xterm yet and it's compiled against the older glibc
If you did an upgrade before dist-upgrade LOTS more stuff would be broken
